Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ServerRcptToReplyHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ServerReplyHandler
    public interface ServerRcptToReplyHandler
extends ServerReplyHandler
    Handler for RCPT TO command response.

    This handler receives the server's response to a RCPT TO command. The interface returned depends on whether the recipient was accepted:

    • On success (250/251/252), the handler receives ClientEnvelopeReady which includes the data() method to proceed to message content.
    • On recipient rejection (4xx/5xx), the handler receives ClientEnvelopeState which allows adding more recipients but may not allow data() if no recipients have been accepted yet.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ClientEnvelopeState.rcptTo(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mime.rfc5322.EmailAddress, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ServerRcptToReplyHandler), ClientEnvelopeReady, ClientEnvelopeState

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ServerReplyHandler

        handleServiceClosing

    • Method Detail

      • handleRcptToOk

        void handleRcptToOk​(ClientEnvelopeReady envelope)
        Called when the recipient is accepted (250, 251, or 252).

        The handler can add more recipients or proceed to send message content using the data() method.

        Response codes:

        • 250 - Recipient OK
        • 251 - User not local; will forward
        • 252 - Cannot VRFY user but will accept message
        Parameters:
        envelope - operations to add more recipients or send data

      • handleTemporaryFailure

        void handleTemporaryFailure​(ClientEnvelopeState state)
        Called when the recipient is temporarily rejected (4xx).

        The handler can try another recipient or abort. The state interface allows data() only if other recipients have been accepted.

        Parameters:
        state - operations to add more recipients or (if any accepted) send data

      • handleRecipientRejected

        void handleRecipientRejected​(ClientEnvelopeState state)
        Called when the recipient is permanently rejected (5xx).

        This specific recipient is not acceptable. Common reasons include:

        • 550 - User not found
        • 551 - User not local
        • 552 - Mailbox full
        • 553 - Mailbox name not allowed

        The handler can try another recipient or abort. The state interface allows data() only if other recipients have been accepted.

        Parameters:
        state - operations to add more recipients or (if any accepted) send data
